instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the dough fermentation monitoring?
Output: The dough fermentation monitoring used near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy technology.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used for dough fermentation monitoring?
Output: Standard normal variate (SNV), multiplicative scatter correction (MSC), first derivative (1st Der), and smoothing filter were used for spectral feature processing in dough fermentation monitoring.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the dough fermentation monitoring models, and how far can this metric go?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the dough fermentation monitoring models was accuracy. The accuracy of the training set and prediction set for both the K-nearest neighbor (KNN) model and the support vector machine (SVM) model were provided. The accuracy of the KNN model was 89% for the training set and 86% for the prediction set. The accuracy of the SVM model was 94% for the training set and 92% for the prediction set. Therefore, the accuracy metric indicates the percentage of correctly predicted fermentation states by the models.

instruction: What machine learning models were used to establish the dough fermentation monitoring models in the related study?
Output: The machine learning models used to establish the dough fermentation monitoring models in the related study were the K-nearest neighbor (KNN) and support vector machine (SVM) models.

instruction: How does the accuracy of the SVM model compare to the KNN model in the dough fermentation monitoring using NIR spectroscopy technology?
Output: The accuracy of the SVM model in the dough fermentation monitoring using NIR spectroscopy technology is higher compared to the KNN model. The training set accuracy of the SVM model is 94%, while the prediction set accuracy is 92%. In contrast, the KNN model has a training set accuracy of 89% and a prediction set accuracy of 86%. Therefore, the SVM model outperforms the KNN model in terms of accuracy for monitoring dough fermentation.
